articles.headline: State Gains Would Give Redistricting Edge to G.O.P.
articles.snippet: Many state legislatures will play a major role in the once-a-decade process of redrawing the boundaries of Congressional districts.
articles.abstract: Many state legislatures will play a major role in the once-a-decade process of redrawing the boundaries of Congressional districts.
articles.lead_paragraph: The midterm elections are being closely watched to determine whether Republicans will have a majority in Congress for the next two years. But it is the outcome of a lower-profile battle over state legislatures that could strengthen the Republican Party for a decade.

articles.headline: H.P. Sues Its Ex-Chief in New Job
articles.snippet: The lawsuit comes a day after the former Hewlett-Packard chief executive was hired by Oracle, the database software maker.
articles.abstract: The lawsuit comes a day after the former Hewlett-Packard chief executive was hired by Oracle, the database software maker.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hewlett-Packard’s tumultuous breakup with its former chief executive Mark V. Hurd may soon warrant its own reality TV show.

articles.headline: Packaging Is All the Rage, and Not in a Good Way
articles.snippet: Amazon is trying to get manufacturers to make packages easier to open, hoping to reduce consumer “wrap rage.”
articles.abstract: Amazon is trying to get manufacturers to make packages easier to open, hoping to reduce consumer “wrap rage.”
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE  Doug Herrington’s office at Amazon.com suggests that he is particularly bad at getting items out of their packages. Along his wall, there is a Philips Norelco shaver still in its plastic clamshell casing, coffee pods in their retail display containers and a bottle of Tide inside a box.

articles.headline: Obama Is Against a Compromise on Bush Tax Cuts
articles.snippet: The president’s decision not to extend tax cuts for the rich adds a populist twist to an economic package designed to entice support from big businesses and their Republican allies.
articles.abstract: The president’s decision not to extend tax cuts for the rich adds a populist twist to an economic package designed to entice support from big businesses and their Republican allies.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday will make clear that he opposes any compromise that would extend the Bush-era tax cuts for the wealthy beyond this year, officials said, adding a populist twist to an election-season economic package that is otherwise designed to entice support from big businesses and their Republican allies.

articles.headline: Bedbugs Bad for Business? Depends on the Business
articles.snippet: Bedbugs are showing up in commercial settings, creating a bonanza for companies that deal with the scourge.
articles.abstract: Bedbugs are showing up in commercial settings, creating a bonanza for companies that deal with the scourge.
articles.lead_paragraph: Recent reports that bedbugs have infiltrated office buildings, movie theaters and stores in New York did not come as a surprise to Wes Tyler, general manager of the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square in San Francisco.

articles.headline: The Bears and the State of Housing
articles.snippet: The difference between viewing housing as a luxury good or as a staple is the subject of a debate about the recovery.
articles.abstract: The difference between viewing housing as a luxury good or as a staple is the subject of a debate about the recovery.
articles.lead_paragraph: Of all the uncertainties in our halting economic recovery, the housing market may be the most confusing of all.

articles.headline: At ABC News After Westin, Risk and Opportunity
articles.snippet: David Westin’s resignation as president represents, in the words of one long-time television news executive, “an inflection point” for the television news industry.
articles.abstract: David Westin’s resignation as president represents, in the words of one long-time television news executive, “an inflection point” for the television news industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: David Westin’s resignation as president of ABC News represents, in the words of one long-time television news executive, “an inflection point” for an industry still trying to figure out how to survive.

articles.headline: Political Ties Shielded Bank in Afghanistan
articles.snippet: An arrangement between the family of the Afghan president and another prominent family is teetering.
articles.abstract: An arrangement between the family of the Afghan president and another prominent family is teetering.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan  In early 2009, as President Hamid Karzai scanned the landscape for potential partners to run in his re-election bid, he was approached from an unusual corner: a bank.
articles.byline: By Adam B. Ellick and Dexter Filkins

articles.headline: Investor Fears Force Split-Up of Irish Bank
articles.snippet: The increasing burden of Anglo Irish Bank’s losses has become a millstone for the government, which is seeking to avoid a Greek-style bank bailout.
articles.abstract: The increasing burden of Anglo Irish Bank’s losses has become a millstone for the government, which is seeking to avoid a Greek-style bank bailout.
articles.lead_paragraph: The European bank panic that rattled markets around the world last spring may have subsided, but the experience has left investors and analysts jumpy about the prospects of more Greek-style bank bailouts.
